title: An improved bound on Seymour's second neighborhood conjecture
abstract:
Seymour's celebrated second neighborhood conjecture, now more than thirty
years old, states that in every oriented digraph, there is a vertex $u$ such
that the size of its second out-neighborhood $N^{++}(u)$ is at least as large
as that of its first out-neighborhood $N^+(u)$. In this paper, we prove the
existence of $u$ for which $|N^{++}(u)| \ge 0.715538 |N^+(u)|$. This result
provides the first improvement to the best known constant factor in over two
decades.
